title: Hotel Gabriel Website
subject: Ux Design/Development
subtitle: UX Design and Front-End Development of hotelgabrielparis.me
concept_description:
The hotel holding company requested a new Hotel Gabriel website with an intergrated custom booking platform that will give the user the possibility to have a complete booking flow entirely on the hotel's website, without being redirected on the main booking engines.

 The project was divided in two main parts: first of all the client requested a WordPress installation as base structure of the hotel's website, the second part consisted in the creation of a suite of web components that allows the user to complete the booking flow.
description:
This set of built-in components are reusable for every hotel of the Holding company and the first project was Hotel Gabriel Paris. The main goal was to share the components in more frontend contexts.

They can be imported in any project without dependencies, in any framework or library, they simply need a basic configuration. Components are made to be customizable and flexible, and they support the multilanguage. In Hotel Gabriel we made them speak with the new Wordpress custom theme we created.
.
description_1:
These components use REST API services made by a partner company, that provide all the necessary booking data.
Web components are made using the WEB COMPONENTS technology, that today is supported in all modern browsers.

To render the components we used Stenciljs, from Ionic team, that provides some polyfills for the legacy browsers such as IE11, to reach a better compatibility.
description_2:
Here are listed the components present in our project:

room list with relative prices,

room detail with all details and prices for different rates,

room rate with detail of prices and sell conditions,

calendar picker with booking dates,

selector for the number of the guests,

summary of what the user has in cart,

list of possible extra to include in the reservation,

customer detail form at the end of the booking flow.

title: Otylight Website
subject: Ux Design/Development
subtitle: UX Design, SEO and Front-End Development of Otylight.com website
concept_description: Otylight request was to redesign the brand's official website with a new and technological look and feel.
description: The peculiarity of this project was the product configurator, a tool developed by Qwentes team to make the user configure the lamp he needs and after produce a pdf with all the selected specs.
description_1: The project started from the creation of the configurator UX functionality and admin panel. After the configurator settings it the organisation of the contents started, building the real website structure. From this point we developed the final UX and code.
description_2: We implemented a brand new Wordpress template to build the graphics and we embedded Qwentes Configurator inside Wordpress CMS.
description_3: Finally we implemented the SEO strategy and analytics, to optimise the website in Google's ranks.

title: Luceplan Website
subject: Ux Design/Development
subtitle: UX Design, SEO and Front-End Development of Luceplan.com website
concept_description: Luceplan request was to redesign the brand's official website with a new and contemporary look. The project had to be ready for the “Salone del Mobile 2017”, where Luceplan was one of the main brands of “Euroluce”, international exhibition of light and lamp design.
description: The peculiarity of this project was the CMS used: Statamic is a “Flat CMS”, based on files and not in DB. Is dynamic, but can behave as a static website, using a sophisticated method of caching, to boost the app's performances.
description_1: The project started from the organisation of the contents, grouping them in macro areas, building the real website structure. From this point we developed the UX.
description_2: Following the guidelines given from CCRZ, a Swiss graphic design studio, we built the graphic style of the site with a fresher and cleaner look and feel, very simple, focusing on beautiful photos of Luceplan products.
description_3: Finally we implemented the SEO strategy and analytics, to optimise the website in Google's ranks.

title: Osteria Francescana
subject: Digital Art Direction
subtitle: Concept of a new Digital Experience for the 3 Michelin stars restaurant Osteria Francescana. The aim is to differenciate the restaurant Experience with the digital one which has to be worth feeling as eating the chef's courses.
concept_description: I choose to show in digital what clients in restaurant rarely can feel, the history of each creation, genially crafted by chef Massimo Bottura inspired by colours, art and music to convey the sense of a work of art.
description: Basically the website is an art Gallery, which uses the digital media to emotionally engage the user creating a bond with the dishes even before or without tasting them for real. It’s a sort of un-conventional online menu which includes, as ingredients, the phylosophy of the author, sorrounded by a matching symphony, as Massimo Bottura is used to do.

title: Nike for Rio 2016
subject: Integrated Communication
subtitle: Advertising campaign for Nike at Olympic Games of Rio 2016.
concept_description: After a deep research about Nike’s values and the city of Rio, it turned out an intresting comparison between the sport attitude of athlets and the change in behavior of Rio de Janeiro in the last years towards a better situation. Based on these findings it has been evolved the idea that anything can change with effort, perseverance and motivation just making the first step to our goal.
description: From this concept it started the #onestepcloser campaign of Nike, inviting people to be perseverant and improve their lives like Rio did with simple lifestyle goals to accomplish during olympic games such as: use less the phone, use less the car or visit frequently a specific place. To do this Nike launches a worldwide app that lets users set their goals and track their progresses. This app will be the core of a huge campaign that wants to give the impression that Nike owns the world during Olympic Games’ period.
description_1: This impression is achieved by using a lot of communication touchpoints around cities that will introduce the concept and bring users to download the app. The first event that opens tha campaign and launches the app is a big marathon worldwide, a race against oneself that will be also the closing event of the campaign wich will reward those who beat their first race-time. After the marathon there will be active a series of interactive and static touchpoints around the most important cities of the world.

title: RayBan US
subject: Ux Design
subtitle: Creation of a new responsive website for Ray-Ban USA, with a strong focus on Design and User Experience.
concept_description: The Project started with a deep analisys of the brand, followed by the creation of personas and wireframes. The aim was to find a creative way to build the ecommerce reflecting Ray-Ban’s personality without losing the UX aspect.
description: For this purpose the first step has been focused on cleaning the interface, proceed to the simplification of the structure of the whole purchasing system and then designing interactions that help the user to navigate. The last step has been analyzing RayBan services and introduce shoppable experiences as the one in the home-page and new services such as the comparison between models to offer a better service to customers.
description_1: The SEO strategy focused more on increasing user traffic in the eyeglasses section. After a deep SEO Audit some elements must be improved such as: the URL structure ( also titles as a consequence ); the navigation and the secondary menu arrangement. To reinforce internal linking and the user traffic there were introduced more call to actions linking to specific pages inside the most visited ones, and also some short descriptions with relevant keywords inside as a compromise between clean UI design and SEO. Based on these findings after the creation of the new tree structure the last step of the project has been producing detailed wireframes.
description_2: The SEM strategy focused on increase sales by bringing more people to the site, with special attention to customized products. The aim is to create appealing campaigns that could engage our target.
description_3: In order to push the customized glasses sales we are planning to create a techinicolor week. Every day of the week will have a specific color promoted, the user should add that color in his customized product in order to get the discount on the final result. This campaign can be used for the holiday season but can be also adapted in order to set “RayBan culture” in a period of the year.
